title: ECO 111 (2020/2021)
question: How does the business sector respond to a shortfall in actual aggregate consumption expenditures caused by the excessive planned savings by households?
optionA: by increasing their planned investment expenditures for the next period
optionB: by cutting down on their planned investment expenditures for the next period
optionC: by stabilizing their planned investment expenditures occasioned by excessive households' savings
optionD: by stabilizing their planned investment expenditures occasioned by the reduced households' savings
correctAnswer: by cutting down on their planned investment expenditures for the next period

question: Which of the following statements is correct?
optionA: unemployment is defined with respect to only the labour force and not the entire population of a country
optionB: Unemployment rate is measured as a ratio of the labour force to the number of unemployed persons in the country
optionC: An economy is at "full employment" when the rate of unemployment is just equal to the natural rate
optionD: the natural rate of unemployment can be reduced through policies that impact on the supply side of the economy
correctAnswer: An economy is at "full employment" when the rate of unemployment is just equal to the natural rate

title: ECO 111 (2020/2021)
question: Which of the following statements is incorrect?
optionB: Inflation can be controlled with the use of contractionary monetary policy
optionC: Inflation can be controlled with the use of expansionary fiscal policy
optionD: Inflation and unemployment rates when added gives a nation's misery index
correctAnswer: Inflation can be controlled with the use of expansionary fiscal policy

optionB: a smaller increase in output and a smaller decrease in the interest rate
optionC: a larger increase in output and a larger decrease in the interest rate

correctAnswer: a larger increase in output and a smaller decrease in the interest rate
